p: Drugs related to lipid metabolism also affect postprandial blood lipids ( 110). Statins are considered an effective method to prevent and treat CVD because they can significantly reduce the level of TG ( 11). In obese and diabetic patients, postprandial FMD was improved by statins ( 111â€“ 113). Changes in postprandial lipoprotein metabolism after statins have been studied ( 114), and atorvastatin significantly reduced postprandial TG, TRL apoB48, VLDL, and IDL apoB100 levels in T2D patients with high TG levels ( 115). However, it is still controversial whether statins can reduce the level of apoB48 in patients with hypertriglyceridemia ( 110).
